name: Automate Multi-Platform Social Media Lookup from Google Sheets with Gemini AI

user.name: Open Paws
user.bio:
Open Paws is a nonprofit building open-source AI tools to accelerate animal advocacy. 

We create machine learning models and automation workflows trained on real-world campaign data to help end industrial animal exploitation. 

All tools are free, transparent, and designed for real-world impact.

description:
## üìå Who‚Äôs it for

This template is designed for **campaigners, researchers, and organizers who need to enrich spreadsheets of contacts with publicly available social media profiles**. Ideal for advocacy campaigns, outreach, or digital organizing where fast, scalable people lookup is needed.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What it does

This workflow scans a Google Sheet for rows marked as unanalysed (`"Analysed?" = false`), sends each contact to a dedicated AI-powered research agent, and returns structured public profile links across major platforms like:

- Twitter/X  
- LinkedIn  
- Facebook  
- Instagram  
- GitHub  
- TikTok  
- YouTube  
- Reddit  
- Threads  
- Medium  
- Substack  
- And more (18+ total)

It processes one contact per run for clarity and stability, appending the results back to the original Google Sheet.

## üõ†Ô∏è How to set it up

1. **Copy the [Google Sheet template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nZ8a7MCU-Ku99cRsBkyer-zUPUb-QcMBzovzU3E-IH4/edit?usp=sharing)**  
   ‚Üí This sheet includes sample columns and headers for contacts and social profile fields.
2. Paste your contact list at the end of the sheet.
3. For each new contact, make sure the **"Analysed?"** column is set to `false`.
4. Clone this workflow and [the AI Research Agent subworkflow](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/).
5. Connect your Google Sheets account in n8n.
6. Update the workflow with your sheet ID and sheet name (`Sheet1` by default).
7. Trigger the workflow on a schedule (e.g. every 15 minutes) or run it manually.

## ‚úÖ Requirements

- **Google Sheets integration** set up in n8n
- Access to [this AI research subworkflow](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/)  
- OpenRouter API key
- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)

## üß© How to customize the workflow

- Modify the research agent to prioritize specific platforms or return only verified profiles.
- Add more profile columns to the Google Sheet and schema to match your custom fields.
- Add logic to send alerts (email, Slack, etc.) for specific contacts.
- Use an n8n webhook instead of a schedule to run the process on demand.
- Use a loop over all items to process all rows sequentially (only recommended for small datasets due to memory constraints)

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

workflow.name: Automate social media profile lookup from Google Sheets with AI

value.chatInput:
=Find the social media profile URLs for this individual or company across all major platforms. Return the results in a structured JSON format with null values for any platforms where the profile couldn't be found. Include the following platforms:

1. Twitter/X
2. LinkedIn
3. Facebook
4. Instagram
5. YouTube
6. TikTok
7. Reddit
8. Mastodon
9. Truth Social
10. Threads
11. Bluesky
12. Pinterest
13. Snapchat
14. Telegram
15. WhatsApp Business
16. Medium
17. GitHub
18. Twitch

For each platform, provide either:
- The direct URL to the verified profile
- Null if no profile exists or couldn't be found

Format the response as a JSON object with platform names as keys:

{
  "twitter": "https://twitter.com/example",
  "linkedin": "https://linkedin.com/in/example",
  "facebook": "https://facebook.com/example",
  "instagram": "https://instagram.com/example",
  "youtube": "https://youtube.com/example",
  "tiktok": "https://tiktok.com/@example",
  "reddit": "https://reddit.com/user/example",
  "mastodon": "https://mastodon.social/@example",
  "truth_social": "https://truthsocial.com/@example",
  "threads": "https://threads.net/@example",
  "bluesky": "https://bsky.app/profile/example.bsky.social",
  "pinterest": "https://pinterest.com/example",
  "snapchat": "https://snapchat.com/add/example",
  "telegram": "https://t.me/example",
  "whatsapp_business": "https://wa.me/example",
  "medium": "https://medium.com/@example",
  "github": "https://github.com/example",
  "twitch": "https://twitch.tv/example"
}

When searching:

    Prioritize verified accounts when available
    Check common variations of the name (first name, last name, initials, nicknames)
    If multiple potential matches exist, choose the most likely one based on context

Additional instructions:

    If the contact is a business or organization, look for official company pages
    For public figures, check both personal and official accounts
    For researchers or academics, check ResearchGate and Academia.edu
    For developers, check Stack Overflow and Dev.to
    For journalists, check Substack and other publishing platforms

# INPUT (this is the individual or company whose social media links you are looking for)

{{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

parameters.inputSchema:
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  "title": "Social Media Profiles Schema",
  "description": "A schema for capturing social media profile URLs for any contact",
  "type": "object",
  "required": [
    "twitter",
    "linkedin",
    "facebook",
    "instagram",
    "youtube",
    "tiktok",
    "reddit",
    "mastodon",
    "truth_social",
    "threads",
    "bluesky",
    "pinterest",
    "snapchat",
    "telegram",
    "whatsapp_business",
    "medium",
    "github",
    "twitch"
  ],
  "properties": {
    "twitter": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Twitter/X profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "linkedin": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to LinkedIn profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "facebook": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Facebook profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "instagram": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Instagram profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "youtube": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to YouTube channel. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "tiktok": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to TikTok profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "reddit": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",

    },
    "mastodon": {

    },

    },
    "threads": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],

      "description": "URL to Threads profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "bluesky": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],

    },
    "pinterest": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Pinterest profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "snapchat": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Snapchat profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "telegram": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Telegram profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "whatsapp_business": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to WhatsApp Business profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "medium": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Medium profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "github": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to GitHub profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    },
    "twitch": {
      "type": ["string", "null"],
      "format": "uri",
      "description": "URL to Twitch profile. Must be null if no profile exists."
    }
  },
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "examples": [
    {
      "twitter": "https://twitter.com/example",
      "linkedin": null,
      "facebook": "https://facebook.com/example",
      "instagram": null,
      "youtube": "https://youtube.com/example",
      "tiktok": null,
      "reddit": "https://reddit.com/user/example",
      "mastodon": null,
      "truth_social": null,
      "threads": null,
      "bluesky": null,
      "pinterest": null,
      "snapchat": null,

      "twitch": null
    },
    {
      "twitter": null,
      "linkedin": "https://linkedin.com/in/example",
      "facebook": null,
      "instagram": null,
      "youtube": null,
      "tiktok": null,
      "reddit": null,

schema.id: PASTE ALL NAMES & KNOWN CONTACT DETAILS HERE
schema.displayName: PASTE ALL NAMES & KNOWN CONTACT DETAILS HERE

parameters.content:
# üß≠ Workflow Overview

This n8n workflow automates the process of finding and storing social media profile links for a list of contacts.

## üí° How It Works
1. Pulls unprocessed contacts from a Google Sheet.
2. Sends the contact info to a research subworkflow that uses AI tools to find social media profiles.
3. Validates and structures the results.
4. Updates the original sheet with found links and marks the contact as "Analysed".

üîÅ The workflow runs automatically on a schedule and processes one contact per execution.

# üìÑ Google Sheet Setup Instructions

üìã Template:  
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1nZ8a7MCU-Ku99cRsBkyer-zUPUb-QcMBzovzU3E-IH4/edit?usp=sharing

## ‚úÖ How to Use the Template
1. **Make a copy** of the Google Sheet into your own Drive.
2. Paste your contact list beside the preset columnns
3. In the `Analysed?` column, enter `false` (no quotes) for every new row.
4. Do not remove or rename existing columns except for the `PASTE ALL NAMES & KNOWN CONTACT DETAILS HERE` column

The workflow updates each row once processed. Make sure the "Analysed?" flag is set properly.

# üß† Subworkflow: Find Social Media Links

Calls this reusable agent:  
üîó https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/

## What It Does:
- Searches for the contact‚Äôs profiles on 18+ platforms:
  Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube, Reddit, TikTok, GitHub, etc.
- Prioritizes verified or official accounts
- Outputs a JSON object with either a link or `null` per platform

# üß± Structure and Validate Response

Uses a strict schema to:
- Ensure the JSON is valid and well-formed
- Normalize missing profiles to `null`
- Confirm all 18+ platforms are present as keys

‚úÖ Prevents malformed or unexpected results from reaching the sheet.

# üìù Google Sheets: Update Contact

Writes the results back into the **same row** in the original sheet.

- Fills in all social media columns with URLs or `null`
- Sets `Analysed?` to `true`
- Uses `row_number` to update the correct contact

üìå Final step to mark the contact as completed!
